Description: Papyrus (three large and nine tiny fragments). Demotic accounts on the recto. Traces of a washed-off text on the verso. Fragment A: col. 1, part of nine lines; col. 2, part of 12 lines. Fragment B: beginning of three lines. Fragment C; traces of two lines.
Curator's comments: Part of 1977,1105.121 (= 10967). Both texts are written in the same hand and contain many of the same personal names. The hand is Ptolemaic. There are month and day dates, but no regnal-years. Most of the text is made up of names of individuals, but in Fragment A, col. 2, line 10, there is a mention of 'wine'.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380962) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380962)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bloom, brittle, displaced fragments, fractured, fragile, frayed, insect attack Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: kraft paper Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
